Key Match Events: Powell had 24 points in the Clippers' 105-103 win over a determined Toronto team
Immanuel Quickley (21 points and four assists in 25 minutes) nearly pushed the game down himself in his first game back from a bruised pelvis he suffered on opening night
Quickley had a game-tying drive and game-tying three in the final 1:39
Pre-Game Insights: The Raptors had two days to prepare in Los Angeles
The Clippers had enough to overcome a Raptors team that had fresh legs
The Raptors' fresh legs served them well as they came back from down nine with just under six minutes left
Post-Match Reflections: Powell was excited and grateful for the opportunity to play against his former team
Quickley felt good just to be out there competing, but it would have felt even better if they had got the dub
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Clippers rank just 27th in NBA attendance, averaging 16,643 fans per night in an arena built to hold 18,000
The Clippers' owner Steve Ballmer has been trying to deliver a championship-level team and crowds to match
The Raptors ended up paying Gary Trent Jr. roughly the same as what Powell ended up earning when he signed a five-year, $90 million contract with Portland
Others: Powell was averaging 25.7 points a game while connecting on 51.6 per cent of his field goal attempts and 48.4 per cent from three on 8.6 attempts per game before the game
Powell was one of the most prolific and efficient shooters in the sport
Powell has been one of the best stories in the NBA if you gravitate toward objectively good people having a breakout year in their 10th season
